Bjarne Andersen wrote:
> A lot of HTML-forms look like this:
> <form action="hjemmeside_kontakt.asp" method="post" name="form" 
> onsubmit="return check()">
> 
> It seems that heritrix finds the link to hjemmeside_kontakt.asp - can 
> anyone tell me which default extractor does this ?
> 
> Would it be possible to filter out links found in form-elements that 
> have method="post"

It is the default ExtractorHTML. There's no current switch to
avoid fetching POST actions, but it could be added. It sounds
like a necessary feature for the future.

It would be easier to add an option to not follow all 'action'
links, than to make it conditional on 'method', because the
current parsing, once it is inside an element (like 'form')
that might contain URI attributes, looks at each attribute
independently. (So making it conditional on 'method' would
require a little more running state in just the 'form'
situation.)

> I just go an email from an angry webmaster that had just recieved 11.000 
> emails due to this script.
> 
> The asp-script should not send emails on get-requests - but it does and 
> we're afraid a lot of scripts out there does that.

We've received or heard of similar problems before, but they've
been fairly rare, and have been addressed with a block on all
URIs of a certain pattern, rather than a method=POST-block.

- Gordon @ IA
